description: Beginning comprehensive analysis of all flowspec-cli commands
context: User requested deep analysis of all commands to identify gaps between intended functionality and actual behavior

description: Created build-docs/cli/ directory for documentation output
rationale: User specified new subfolder for all command documentation

description: Each command gets command-objective-<cmd>.md and command-fixes-<cmd>.md files
rationale: User-specified format for tracking objectives vs current state

description: Identified 50 total commands across 11 top-level and 8 subcommand groups
details: Top-level: version, init, upgrade-repo, upgrade-tools, upgrade, check, dev-setup, tasks, quality, gate, ac-coverage. Groups: backlog, workflow, config, hooks, memory, vscode, telemetry, security, constitution

description: Tested each command with --help, then ran actual execution to verify behavior
rationale: Help text alone doesn't reveal implementation gaps

description: flowspec init command works correctly with full two-stage download
dev-setup help text doesn't clearly communicate it's ONLY for flowspec developers
flowspec check works but shows 'downgrade' recommendation for newer versions
flowspec tasks --format markdown is advertised but NOT IMPLEMENTED
quality help says default is .flowspec/spec.md but looks for spec.md
flowspec gate works correctly with proper exit codes
security triage, fix, and audit are PLACEHOLDERS - advertised but not implemented
security scan requires external semgrep installation
constitution version shows template placeholders when in source repo
Created 30 documentation files (15 objective + 15 fixes) covering all command groups
HIGH priority: security placeholders. MEDIUM priority: dev-setup docs, tasks markdown, external deps. LOW priority: cosmetic issues
